title: Problem opening PDF files when drafting an email
content: Hi, since some months ago, when I'm drafting a new email and I attach a PDF file, if I want to open it (before sending the email, during the draft) I can't, I receive an error (Spanish translation) "the file could not be opened because the associated app doesn't exist. But the associated app exists and is well configurated in preferences... I upload images. Many thanks and regards.

title: Converting Windows Live Mail emails and contacts to Thunderbird
content: I have installed Thunderbird version 115.2.0 on my Windows 7 pc. I want to migrate/convert all of my saved Live Mail messages and contacts to Thunderbird before I get a new computer. None of the Thunderbird add-ons for doing this are compatible with the 115.2.0 version. Maybe I could install an older version of Thunderbird, get add-ons that are compatible with that version, convert my data and then upgrade to the latest version of Thunderbird? Any suggestions?
creator: leventons

title: Unable to send emails after upgrading to Thunderbird 115
content:
All of a sudden, since yesterday, I cannot send any emails via TB since I upgraded to the 115-version. I've never experienced this before using TB.

Sending emails elsewhere from - by directly logging in to hotmail or from my phone - is no problem whatsoever.

But on TB115, when attempting to send a mail, an empty pop-up window appears with the headline "Enter credentials for (my emailaddress) on smtp.office365.com", before closing again. After a short while attempting to deliver the message, an error box reads: "Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because the connection to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp.office365.com timed out. Try again."

SMTP settings: Outlook.com (Microsoft) smtp.office365.com Port 587 STARTTLS OAuth2

Any solutions?
creator: runikorsgaard

title: Font size in version 115 too small, spacing too close in inbox pane
content:
Just got the new version 115.2.0 64 bit version yesterday. The font size is way too small in the inbox pane and there's not enough spacing. Very difficult to read.

Thanks!
creator: BradNewsync

title: Trouble getting emails after changing from POP to IMAP
content:
For many years I have been using Mozilla Thunderbird for my emails. I have 3 email accounts Gmail and two Bigpond accounts. The Bigpond accounts were set up as POPs.

However, I recently bought a new mobile phone from Telstra and when the technician was setting it up for me he suggested it would be a good idea to be able to access my Bigpond emails as well as having Gmail. This required using the IMAP settings.

I have attempted to change the Thunderbird settings for my Bigpond email accounts to IMAP and eventually I have this working "sort of". I am not sure if I am receiving all my mail and when I do it seems to download about a day late - so not getting emails for today until either very late in the day or the next day.

Can you please help.

Thank you, Sue.
creator: zoozieg45

title: transfer thunderbird to new computer
content: I have been using Thunderbird for many years and I love it. I just bought a new computer and tried to place my old Thunderbird into the new computer. The program asked for my email address and then it ask for my password which I put in. Then it tells me that it failed. I have tried everything I can using the internet for help and nothing has allowed me to make this transfer. I've spent hours and hours on this thing. The correct information on my old Thunderbird account has not changed and you can see all details on that account. I need personal assistance to get this thing going. I don't want to see my profile go away. I have the profile on one OneDrive and I also copied and saved the old profile from the old computer. Please help me. Thank you. Bob Wendel
creator: rwendel

title: Thunderbird doesn't receive emails
content: My Thunderbird program stopped receiving emails about 36 hours ago. I can send email from Thunderbird, but not send. I can receive emails if I sign onto the email server on the web. But Thunderbird does not receive. Thanks.

title: Can't find "Archive" folder on "Local Folders"
content:
I've set my account settings to keep message archives in the "Archives" folder on "Local folders." However, the folder list on the left side menu doesn't display "Archives" folder under "Local folders." When I try to create an "Archives" folder there, Thunderbird tells me there's already a folder with that name.

How can I access the "Archives" folder?

NB: I'm using Thunderbird 115.2.0 (64 bit) on a PC running Windows 11.

Thanks for your help.

title: User Interface all black
content: I recently downloaded Thunderbird 15.2. My mail screen is basically all black background showing my mail etc. But, I don't have all the tabs where it's blue and white that is shown in the picture. How do I enable them?

title: Thunderbird Mail pages are jumpy
content:
Within the last month, Thunderbird mail pages have become jumpy.

When you delete an email message, about 90% of the time instead of the highlighted bar dropping to the next email below, the bar will jump to the next page; skipping over many emails.

Why doesn't the highlighted bar just drop to the next email? It used to do that? Why the change? Or is it a glitch?

I'm using a Windows 11 Laptop.

[removed email from public]

title: Mismatch between Profile and Application Disables Thunderbird
content:
Version 115.2 dramatically changed my long loved and used profile settings. This is the first time, ever, that happened. I could not seem to recover the profile setting I needed. I used the Time Machine capability of my MacOS and retrieved an older version of the profile. Thunderbird then refused to open at all due to the mismatch between Profile and Application. I ended up resetting my entire computer to an earlier date. (Losing a ton of emails.) Should I allow Thunderbird to update to 115.2 again, of is the same miserable affair going to repeat?

Bill S

The other 4 will download to current emails but after a few weeks it deletes the older e-mails. I'm assuming its a settings thing but I didn't touch any of the settings. This all started 6-8 months ago! Any suggestions?

title: Aktualizace na Thunderbird 115.2.0 (64 bitů)
content:
Dovoluji si ohlásit problém vzniklý při aktualizaci na Thunderbird 115.2.0 (64 bitů): Po aktualizaci se přestaly stahovat zprávy z outlooku a objevují se chybové hlášky viz přiložené obrázky. Navíc po stisknutí tlačítka "Opravit složku", která je v Obecných informacích se mi vymazala pošta za celý rok (tj. od 09/2022 do 09/2023, což mě odrazuje od dalšího používání této verze.

Otázka zní, jak lze obnovit tuto smazanou poštu a jak se vrátit k předchozí bezproblémové verzi Thundrbirdu.

O Supernovu už opravdu nemám zájem.
creator: jh19xx

title: Warning when using identity provider
content:
I'm trying to configure a Google Workspace email address in Supernova that uses its own Identity provider. The problem is that I get a "Warning: Potential Security Risk Ahead" when the Gmail login does the redirection to such identity provider (see screenshot). Unlike Firefox, it doesn't display an option button to proceed with it anyways. Is there a workaround for this?

Thanks!
creator: pablo29

title: Thunderbird 115: opening RSS links
content: Before 115, I could view the summary of a RSS link in the preview pane, double-clicking it opened a TB tab with the full web version of the link. In 115, the views between preview pane and the tab seem to sync, it either Web page both both panes, or Summary for both. It there a way to set different views for the different panes? Thanks!
creator: mbzhmqtg

title: Messages in outbox not shown as unread (by default) in Thunderbird 115.2.0
content:
When using Send Later (e.g. via CTL+Shift+Enter), prior to V115.2.0 Outbox messages were shown as Unread by default (and so it was obvious that there messages awaiting sending). This no longer happens (i.e. such messages show as read) and so messages in the Outbox can easily be forgotten.

Is there a setting (or something accessible via the Config Editor to revert to the previous behaviour? Or is this simply a bug?

Thanks
creator: bazzaman

title: Thunderbird is not receiving POP3 mail after updating to v 115.2.0
content: After updating Thunderbird to version 115.2.0 (from 102.15.0) I no longer receive email from the server. Servername: pop3.mail.dk I can see mail on the server with WEBmail And btw I'm used to get prompted for password when cliking "Get messages" - this is no longer the case. What is wrong?

title: One out of 6 emails stopped working in Thunderbird, iPhone and iPad
content: I have multiple emails and they were all working just fine in Thunderbird, iPhone and iPad for a long time. Now only one of them stopped working. Thunderbird, iPhone and iPad all no longer recognize the password for one of them but do for all the rest of my emails! They all have the OAuth2 setting. The error message is "Unable to log in at server. Probably wrong configuration, username or password." The error message came after telling me it was found in the Mozilla ISP database. I know everything is typed correctly just like for all the other emails. It does still work on my computer on mail.google.com so I know the login information is correct! This is my email I use to log into PayPal so I know the password is correct! I'm so baffled. Thanks for any help I can get.
creator: Murraysmom

title: Impostazioni Thunderbird - Thunderbird Settings
content:
Buongiorno, nelle impostazioni di Thunderbird (115.2.0), pur avendo selezionato dalle 3 opzioni 'Aprire i messaggi' su 'nuova scheda' o 'finestra esistente', al doppio clic su un messaggio questo si apre sempre in una nuova finestra. Come posso risolvere il problema?

Good morning, in Thunderbird settings (115.2.0), despite having selected 'new tab' or 'existing window' from the 3 'Open messages' options, double-clicking on a message always opens in a new window. How can I solve the problem?

Thanks in advance l da rold
creator: lodarold

title: Deleting emails in bulk issue...protocol has changed in Thunderbird.
content:
Hello all, I let my emails stack up and have a large number to delete when I decide to clear them. I used to be able to type into the search box in thunderbird...'ebay'...all ebay emails would be listed in an uncomplex list form. I could see at a glance all I wanted to delete and mails I would save. I could previously select all and delete.

Typing 'ebay' using the search bar now...the list includes part of the email and sometimes emails that are unrelated to ebay and a complex way to delete mails. So I need to carefully look through all mails before I delete. Is there any way to get back to the old method using the search bar?

Please let me know, Thanks :-) Jb
creator: creativejla

title: helyi mappa
content:
Jó napot kívánok!

- A Thunderbirdben "eltűntek" a helyi mappáim és a legújabb verzióban (115.2) nem tudom újra láthatóvá tenni őket, pedig sok mailt oda mentettem. Milyen módon tudom a helyi mappákat ismét megjeleníteni?

- A régebbi verzióban az "üzenetek letöltése" gomb mellett volt egy kis nyíl, így én választhattam meg melyik postafiókomat szeretném letölteni. Ez most nincs, és nekem hiányzik. Milyen alternatív megoldás létezik, hogy csak egy adott fiókot leveleit töltse le?

A segítséget előre is köszönöm: Honti György

creator: ggreen71

title: Outlook 365 SMTP and Oauth2
content:
Recently, my College switched to Outlook 365 mail.

I'm running the latest 64 bit Thunderbird on Windows 10.

We use OAuth2 for incoming and outgoing.

Incoming server is outlook.office365.com. OAuth2 is an authentication option. Fine. I use Microsoft Authenticator, and it works.

But, Thunderbird will not or cannot use OAuth2 on the SMTP sever, smtp-mail.outlook.com. It simply doesn't list the OAuth2 option. Even if I go back in and try to edit the server, it won't give me that option.

Other clients detect it fine.
creator: mrsubway

title: Emails in my inbox disappeared after installing Thunderbird 115.2.0
content: My Thunderbird email reader was updated to 115.2.0 earlier today. It looks good except that NONE of my existing emails in the Inbox appear. How do I get the emails back?
creator: pawlaww

title: odd "null" text appears on message window below menu and above toolbar
content:
After installing Thunderbird 115.2.0 (64-bit) yesterday, all of my email messages (not when I'm composing, but all that I receive and those that I later view from my Sent folder), have this odd "null" text in the top left corner, below the menu and just above (and to the left of) the window toolbar.

Any ideas what could be causing that (and how to fix it)? I expect it's taking up a whole line (i.e., if I can get rid of it, the toolbar will presumably move up to be immediately under the menu).
creator: doug-TBird
